title: Losing Connection to Firefox Account Every Time Firefox Closes
content: Starting yesterday 4/10/22 I'm having a weird issue. Every time I open Firefox all of my personalization and bookmarks are gone. It shows that I'm signed in, but when I go into the Settings and go to the Sync section the page will refresh and suddenly show I'm not signed in. I will then attempt to sign back in, but after entering my password I just get stuck on the page with the circle spinning and a small banner saying "working." Once this happens, the only solution I've found is to open the Troubleshooter and use the Refresh option. This brings everything back, though I have to go through MFA hassle to get logged back in to my regular website. The problem is that every time I close Firefox, when I reopen it it's once again broken and I have to go through a Refresh again in order to be able to sign back in to sync.

title: since v99 css filter pixelates background image
content:
Hello,

hope this is a good place to ask about my issue with the new version Firefox version 99:

For showing images on a website I create divs with css3d rendered png background-images (scaled down through css transforms from 1000px x 1000px) and later apply css filters eg. "filter:drop-shadow(red 10px 10px 10px)".

Tested on various Win10 and MacOs machines with v98.0.2 and older, images get displayed with a drop-shadow in best quality. Updating to v99, once any filter gets applied (through dev console or through js within my software) the image quality is reduced a lot, which did not happen before. I attached a sample image from v99 (left: added filter, right: same image without filter).

When scaling the websites zoom factor to 500% the images will be displayed correctly without any quality loss. Scaling to 30% results in a very bad render.

I tried applying image-rendering to no avail. It would visibly change the render mode, but not improve the actual quality. The pixelated image would still be pixelated with the new render mode.

I'm not sure how to further tackle this problem and hope someone could help with this issue.

Thanks Max

title: nejde mi stáhnout FormApps Firefox Extension
content:
Potřebuji odeslat na sociálku formulář a toto mi to hlásí: I když vše povolím, odklikám, stále nelze formulář odeslat a stále ot hlásí stejnou chybu...

Formulář vyžaduje rozšířenou funkčnost, kterou nelze zajistit stávajícími prostředky tohoto webového prohlížeče.

Je potřeba: 1) instalovat rozšíření prohlížeče ( FormApps Firefox Extension ) 2) instalovat externí aplikaci ( FormApps Signing Extension ), která s tímto rozšířením spolupracuje.

Po nainstalování klikněte na tlačítko Další... Rozšíření stále ještě není instalováno nebo není povoleno.

title: Quando si apre un file con un'applicazione il file viene salvato anche nella cartella Download
content:
Buongiorno, mi sono reso conto che dalle ultime versioni di Firefox, quando si apre un file con un'applicazione il file viene salvato anche nella cartella Download. Anche, ad esempio, i PDF visualizzati in Firefox vengono salvati nella cartella Download anziché nella cartella Temp com'era precedentemente. Non c'è modo di ripristinare questa funzionalità? Lo chiedo perché, correggetemi se sbaglio, le cartelle Temp vengono periodicamente svuotate in automatico, mentre la Download no. Siccome poi non la apro frequentemente, i file si accumulano al suo interno.

Grazie mille!

title: Firefox lost audio connection with Windows 10 (YouTube)
content:
Interestingly, today after changing motherboards and my old hard drives after my old MB died. Windows 10 reconfigured everything for audio except Firefox. After a lot of troubleshooting using various methods with no success (as all other aspects of windows 10 audio were working perfectly), I eventually stumbled upon a solution that finally worked for me.

In Windows 10, there is an app that varies individual app volume that eventually fixed my issue and i thought it best to post here for others, if they also have this particular problem.

All i did was the following:

1. Do a windows search for "App Volume". This will display Sound Mixer Options. Select it.

2. In the App Volume and device preferences screen that appears, go to Mozilla Firefox. 

        a.  Ensure Volume is at a setting you prefer.          b.  Output/Input are most likely showing Default.  Mine did but YouTube video's still had no sound.              Change the Defaults to the same as the Masters at the top of the window and try your audio.              Mine started to work again at this stage.  After i confirmed everything was working again, i changed              Mozilla Firefox Output/Inputs back to Default and it continued to work perfectly.

Please note that I made sure all my OTHER audios were working first with W10 before doing this, ensuring everything was functioning properly. ie. Other browsers were playing youtube videos with sound, playing an audio music file, etc

title: Problem linking to WhatsApp Web using Firefox (v99) with Save History = No
content:
Problem linking to WhatsApp Web using Firefox (v99) with Save History = No

Hello! I have been a Firefox user for many years. I am registered with the account cso91581-firefoxsync@yahoo.es

I have a problem linking a device to WhatsApp when I use Firefox (v99) with the option "Don't remember History".

I've done a Firefox Refresh and without adding any of my add-ons, when I checked Save History = No, Firefox goes into a loop, increasing CPU usage. If I choose Save History = Yes, everything works fine.

WhatsApp is widely used in Spain (I think we are the second country in the world after Brazil). Until recently, linking the device was optional, but since a few days it has been mandatory. I use the Save History = No option, as it allows you to make all Firefox tabs private, which I find comfortable and safe.

I have tried pairing the device. During the error I have opened the console. I attach two screenshots.

I would appreciate a response from you.

Receive a cordial greeting, Osvaldo

Problema en la vinculación a WhatsApp Web utilizando Firefox (v99) con Guardar Historial = No

Hola! Soy usuario de Firefox desde hace mucho años. Estoy registrado con la cuenta cso91581-firefoxsync@yahoo.es

Tengo un problema en la vinculación de un dispositivo a WhatsApp cuando utilizo Firefox (v99) con la opción “No recordar el Historial”.

He realizado un Refresh de Firefox y, sin añadir ninguno de mis complementos, cuando he marcado Guardar Historial = No, Firefox entra en un bucle, aumentando el consumo de CPU. Si elijo Guardar Historial = Sí, todo funciona bien.

WhatsApp es muy utilizado en España (creo que somos el segundo país del mundo después de Brasil). Hasta hace poco, la vinculación del dispotivo era opcional, pero desde hace unos días es obligatoria. Utilizo la opción Guardar Historial = No, pues permite convertir todas las pestañas de Firefox en privadas, lo que me parece cómodo y seguro.

He intentado realizar la vinculación del dispositivo. Durante el error he abierto la consola. Adjunto dos pantallazos.

Agradecería una respuesta por su parte.

Reciba un cordial saludo, Osvaldo
creator: cso91581-firefoxsync
